Class InputScanner

java.lang.Object
InputScanner
public class InputScanner
extends Object
This class uses InputValidator and allows users to actually input their choices using the Scanner utility. Also allows them to re-enter until they reach a choice that is valid.
Since:
15/11/2021
Author:
20238029 Sergiu Mereacre

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    InputScanner()
    Initialises the input scanner we are going to use to complete all the different requirements from our user.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getAnalyticsChoice()
    User can select a valid choice when selecting an option in the Analytics screen.
    LocalDate getDate()
    Checks the input value from the user so that it is a valid Date.
    int getNumberNeeded()
    Goes through all the reservations and cancellations and checks to see what is the next number available for a reservation number.
    String getPassword​(String username)
    Checks the input value from the user so that it is a valid Password for a specific username.
    int getStartUpChoice()
    User can select a valid choice when selecting an option in the StartUp screen.
    User getUser​(String username)
    Based on the username it returns a specific user.
    int getUserMenuChoice​(int exitValue)
    User can select a valid choice when selecting an option.
    String getUsername()
    Checks the input value from the user so that it is a valid Username from the Admins csv file.
    int getYesOrNo()
    Co-Author: Edison Cai Asks the user for a Y or N input and returns a boolean expression.
    Reservation readReservation()
    Takes the user through a bunch of reservation questions so a reservation instance can be completed.
    Cancellation readValidCancellation()
    This method checks to see if a reservation number is correct or not.

  • Method Details

    • getStartUpChoice

      public int getStartUpChoice()
      User can select a valid choice when selecting an option in the StartUp screen.
      Returns:
      The user's choice.

    • getAnalyticsChoice

      public int getAnalyticsChoice()
      User can select a valid choice when selecting an option in the Analytics screen.
      Returns:
      The user's choice.

    • readReservation

      public Reservation readReservation()
      Takes the user through a bunch of reservation questions so a reservation instance can be completed.
      Returns:
      Completed reservation.

    • getNumberNeeded

      public int getNumberNeeded()
      Goes through all the reservations and cancellations and checks to see what is the next number available for a reservation number.
      Returns:
      A valid reservation number.

    • readValidCancellation

      public Cancellation readValidCancellation()
      This method checks to see if a reservation number is correct or not. If it is validated it can be cancelled.
      Returns:
      The user's chosen cancellation reference based on the reservation number.

    • getUserMenuChoice

      public int getUserMenuChoice​(int exitValue)
      User can select a valid choice when selecting an option.
      Parameters:
      exitValue - The highest value the user can input for a certain menu.
      Returns:
      The user's choice.

    • getDate

      public LocalDate getDate()
      Checks the input value from the user so that it is a valid Date.
      Returns:
      A valid date as a LocalDate.

    • getUsername

      public String getUsername()
      Checks the input value from the user so that it is a valid Username from the Admins csv file.
      Returns:
      A valid username as a String.

    • getPassword

      public String getPassword​(String username)
      Checks the input value from the user so that it is a valid Password for a specific username.
      Parameters:
      username - The inputted username.
      Returns:
      A valid password as a String.

    • getUser

      public User getUser​(String username)
      Based on the username it returns a specific user.
      Parameters:
      username - The inputted username.
      Returns:
      A valid user based on the username.

    • getYesOrNo

      public int getYesOrNo()
      Co-Author: Edison Cai Asks the user for a Y or N input and returns a boolean expression.
      Returns:
      Boolean value depending on the users choice of Y or N.
